snippet: Agencies must adopt newer methods to avoid software failures, delays and cost increases.
abstract: Editorial contends problems with the federal health insurance website highlight need for broad reform in how the government uses technology to deliver public services; suggests agencies adopt newer methods to avoid software failures, like directly hiring programmers, designers and other technologists; says it should also streamline process for soliciting bids for projects to get more businesses to compete for contracts.
